replies.msg:
Consider a linear system Ax=b with the solution x*=A^{-1}b,where A is invertible. It is equivalent to minimise the strictly convex function f(x)=1/2x^
{T}Ax-b^{T}x. Obviously, the linear system is consistent if and only if f bounded below. 點prove最後依個嘢？我惗極唔明。

PS.依個係關於Randomized coordinate descent嘅嘢
